1.text: And when he completed all his words in the ears of the people, he came to Capernaum.

2.text: And a certain centurion’s servant being sick, was about to die; which was highly valued by him.

3.text: And having heard of Jesus, he sent elders of the Jews to him, asking him, that having come, he would save his servant.

4.text: And they approaching to Jesus, besought him earnestly, saying, That he is worthy to whom he will bestow this:

5.text: For he loves our nation, and has built us a synagogue.

6.text: And Jesus went with them. And now he being away not far from the house, the centurion sent friends to him, saying to him, Lord, trouble not thyself: for I am not fit that thou shouldest come under my roof;

7.text: Therefore neither thought I myself worthy to come to thee: but speak in a word, and my servant shall be healed.

8.text: For I also am a man set under authority, having soldiers under myself, and I say to this, Go, and he goes; and to another, Come, and he comes: and to my servant, Do this, and he does.

9.text: And Jesus having heard these, wondered at him, and having turned to the crowd following him, he said, I say to you, Neither have I found so much faith in Israel.

10.text: And those sent, having turned back to the house, found the servant being sick, restored to health.

11.text: And it was in continuation he went to a city called Nain; and sufficient of his disciples went with him, and a great crowd.

12.text: And as he drew near to the gate of the city, behold, he dead was carried out, the only son of his mother, and she a widow; and a sufficient crowd of the city was with her.

13.text: And having seen her, the Lord felt compassion for her and said to her, Weep not.

14.text: And having come, he touched the coffin, and they bearing stood. And he said, Young man, I say to thee, arise.

15.text: And the dead sat up, and began to speak. And he gave him to his mother.

16.text: And fear took all; and they praised God, saying, That a great prophet has risen up among us; and That God has reviewed his people.

17.text: And this word went out about him in all Judea, and in all the country round about.

18.text: And John’s disciples announced to him of all these things.

19.text: And having called certain two of his disciples, John sent to Jesus, saying, Art thou he coming? or should we expect another?

20.text: And the men, having approached to him, said, John the Immerser has sent us to thee, saying, Art thou he coming? or should we expect another?

21.text: And in that same hour he cured many of diseases, and scourges, and evil spirits, and to many blind he conferred the favor to see.

22.text: And Jesus having answered said to them, Having gone, announce to John what ye saw and heard; for the blind look up, the lame walk, the leprous are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, the poor are announced good news.

23.text: And happy is he, whoever should not be offended in me.

24.text: And the messengers of John having departed, he began to say to the crowds concerning John, What went ye forth into the desert to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

25.text: But what went ye out to see? A man clothed in soft garments? Behold, those in glorious clothing, and being in luxury, are in royal abodes.

26.text: But what went ye out to see? A prophet? Yea, I say to you, superior to a prophet.

27.text: This is he of whom it has been written, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, who shall prepare thy way before thee.

28.text: For I say to you, Among the begotten of women none is a greater prophet than John the Immerser; and the less in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

29.text: And all the people having heard, and the publicans, justified God, having been immersed with the immersion of John.

30.text: And the Pharisees, and they pertaining to the law, rejected the counsel of God against themselves, not immersed by him.

31.text: And the Lord said, To whom shall I liken the men of this generation? and to whom are they like?

32.text: They are like children sitting in the market-place, and calling to one another, and saying, We played the flute to you, and ye danced not; we lamented to you, and ye wept not.

33.text: For John the Immerser came, neither eating bread, nor drinking wine, and ye say, He has a demon.

34.text: The Son of man came eating and drinking; and ye say, Behold a man, a glutton, and wine-drinker, a friend of publicans and sinful.

35.text: And wisdom was justified of all her children.

36.text: And a certain one of the Pharisees asked him that he would eat with him. And having come into the Pharisee’s house, he reclined.

37.text: And, behold, a woman in the city, who was sinful, knowing that he is reclining at table in the Pharisee’s house, having brought an alabaster box of perfumed oil,

38.text: And stood at his feet behind, weeping, been to wet his feet with tears, and wiped with the hairs of her head; and she kissed his feet, and anointed with the perfumed oil.

39.text: And the Pharisee having called him, seeing, said within himself, This, if he were a prophet, had known who and what race of woman which had touched him: for she is sinful.

40.text: And Jesus having answered, said to him, Simon, I have something to say to thee. And he says, Teacher, speak.

41.text: Two debtors were to a certain money-lender: one owed five hundred drachmas, and the other fifty.

42.text: And they not having to pay, he bestowed as a gift upon both. Which of them therefore will love him the more? Say thou.

43.text: And Simon, having answered, said, I suppose, that to whom he bestowed more favor. And he said to him, Thou hast judged rightly,

44.text: And having turned to the woman, he said to Simon, Thou seest this woman? I came into thy house, thou gavest me no water for my feet: and she wet my feet with tears, and wiped them with the hairs of her head.

45.text: Thou gavest me no kiss: and she from when I came in left not kissing my feet.

46.text: Thou anointedst not my head with oil: and she anointed my feet with perfumed oil.

47.text: For which I say to thee, Her many sins are remitted; for she loved much: and he to whom little is remitted, loves little.

48.text: And he said to her, Thy sins are remitted.

49.text: And they reclining together began to say in themselves, Who is this who also remits sins?

50.text: And he said to the woman, Thy faith has saved thee; go in peace.
